input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: DILBEEK. Summary: Delivering Meals Via Cold Line Daycare Centers. Description: The assignment concerns the delivery of hot, high-quality and balanced meals via cold line and fruit porridge to the daycare centers of the EVA non-profit organization Gemeentelijke Kinderopvang Dilbeek. The EVA non-profit organization Municipal Childcare Dilbeek has been awarded the contract to care for 109 children aged from 0 to 3 years, spread over three daycare centers. In the future this can be expanded with a daycare center with an estimated capacity of 36 to 48 children. The meals are delivered cold to the three locations and are heated on site in the daycare centers in the existing regeneration oven. The estimated number of meals required annually is 20,000, the estimated number of fruit porridges is 10,000.<br> Category (CPV code): School meals (15894210). Published Date: 2025-10-25. Closing Date: 2025-11-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: Pest Control and other Manual Work in Anb Domains in the Winge and Motte Valleys in Connection with Life Harwin. Description: The assignment involves carrying out various nature management works manually, with an emphasis on carrying out various forms of exotic species control in stocks mainly containing American oak, American bird cherry, sweet chestnut, Robinia or Currant tree. Depending on the circumstances, control is carried out by ringing the trees or by pulling seedlings or young trees. Furthermore, the workers can be deployed for the following type of work: - Manual work drainage ditches in wetter and vulnerable forest stands that are not or hardly accessible to machines, in particular for damming or deepening drainage ditches, by loosening soil next to the stream and that underneath with the forest hoe/spade/shovel in the form of earth dams to dump in the canals. - Small-scale raking/raking out of litter from forests to be converted. - Planting forest greenery - Small-scale reclamation works in swamp forests, consisting of felling with a chainsaw of shrubs and small trees and the winching of this material to collection points at the edge of the plot. - Other minor felling and clean-up work Category (CPV code): Forestry services (77200000). Published Date: 2025-10-16. Closing Date: 2025-11-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Pest Control and other Manual Work in Anb Domains in the Winge and Motte Valleys in Connection with Life Harwin
output.Description: The assignment involves carrying out various nature management works manually, with an emphasis on carrying out various forms of exotic species control in stocks mainly containing American oak, American bird cherry, sweet chestnut, Robinia or Currant tree. Depending on the circumstances, control is carried out by ringing the trees or by pulling seedlings or young trees. Furthermore, the workers can be deployed for the following type of work: - Manual work drainage ditches in wetter and vulnerable forest stands that are not or hardly accessible to machines, in particular for damming or deepening drainage ditches, by loosening soil next to the stream and that underneath with the forest hoe/spade/shovel in the form of earth dams to dump in the canals. - Small-scale raking/raking out of litter from forests to be converted. - Planting forest greenery - Small-scale reclamation works in swamp forests, consisting of felling with a chainsaw of shrubs and small trees and the winching of this material to collection points at the edge of the plot. - Other minor felling and clean-up work Category (CPV code): Forestry services (77200000)

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG ENV - ENVIRONMENT. Summary: Support for the Implementation of the Eu Pledge on Three Billion Additional Trees by 2030. Description: The EU pledge for three billion additional trees in the EU was announced in 2020 (EU Biodiversity Strategy). The implementation of the pledge depends greatly on initiatives at national and subnational level. A roadmap for its implementation with milestones was published in 2021 (EU Forest Strategy). Building on the accomplished milestones (https://environment.ec.europa.eu/strategy/biodiversity-strategy-2030/3-billion-trees_en), the contractor will further promote the implementation of the EU pledge. In particular, it will promote the uptake of the pledge by liaising with potentially interested stakeholders (public and private organisations of land and forest owners, foresters, national and sub-national authorities) in all Member States; it will organise webinars and seminars/conferences; it will support the Commission on the outreach and organisation of the yearly three billion trees award. <br> Doc Title: Support for the implementation of the EU pledge on three billion additional trees by 2030 <br> Contract Type: services. This is a contract lasting one year with the possibility of extending the contract tacitly at most 3 times (see point 2.5 of the specifications). Anyway, the market ends on the right on 03/01/2029. Meals are delivered at least once every 2 weeks in the refrigerator according to the principle of the cold line. Two different age categories are affected. An alternative/regime/gluten -free offer/taking into account allergies/... must be provided for each age group. The conditions of the framework agreement are known and described in the technical provisions of part 3 of this special specifications. Orders have placed through a separate call for tenders. The market is for the Snoopy crèche in Neder-over-Heembeek. The maximum total market value is € 110,000. The order will be automatically terminated either when this amount is reached, or 01/03/2029. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH GOVERNMENT. Summary: Climate Adaptive Transforming of Species -Poor Forests. Description: In the following decades we are heading for a significant warming up of the average annual temperature, with an associated increase in weather extremes. Climate change is much faster than forests can adjust itself. One of the measures to make forests more resilient against Climate change is to increase the number of tree species. We do this by planting "Kloempen" in existing forests - a Kloemp is a group of 25 plants of the same tree species that are planted close together. The most vital tree wins the competition and grows later, if appropriate Management, out for a healthy adult "future tree". - By planting those clamping pen in existing forests, "under the screen" of the Kronendak of the old forest, the plants grow up against extreme heat. - By planting, we accelerate the increase in tree species diversity without first having to perform large -scale hairdressings. We only choose indigenous tree species with a good, digestive leaf litter in those clamping pen. Since the wildlife stand in the Flemish forests is on average very high, the cloem pen against vraat from mainly deer must be protected. We do this with wooden grids (so -called "veblocks") to avoid the use of plastic in forests. Because most sandy soils are acidified in Flanders, we still add substances in the plant pit to offer the plants better growing conditions. This project supports strategic program 7 of the company .... Published Date: 2025-09-04. Closing Date: 2025-10-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: ANTWERP. Summary: Framework Agreement for Felling and Pruning of Trees and Removing Stumps. Description: There are currently around 60,000 street trees in the city of Antwerp, and a multiple of them in parks and green areas. The city wants a safe and well -maintained tree stock. Within the green service, it has a number of employees who are responsible for guidance pruning and simple Velwerken. In addition, the green service has a professional tree team with trained tree carers and European Tree Workers (ETW students). Given the size of the tree stock, the city wants to be able to count on external tree carers for the implementation of expert pruning and velwerk, in addition to the Tree management works carried out by own services. The assignment is divided into 3 plots: plot 1: (form) pruning trees to perform regular cyclical pruning such as the pruning or shaving of shape trees. For these works, solid professional knowledge and experience are required in terms of form pruning. Stake Certified tree carers are not required. Plot 2: Specialized rimworks, maintenance pruning and overdue pruning; Performing veling works, maintenance pruning and overdue pruning. The works are or without a platform or climbing depending on the local situation. For these works, expert tree carers are required with demonstrable education, experience and expertise. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG ENV - ENVIRONMENT. Summary: Support for the Implementation of the Eu Pledge on Three Billion Additional Trees by 2030. Description: The EU pledge for three billion additional trees in the EU was announced in 2020 (EU Biodiversity Strategy). The implementation of the pledge depends greatly on initiatives at national and subnational level. A roadmap for its implementation with milestones was published in 2021 (EU Forest Strategy). Building on the accomplished milestones (https://environment.ec.europa.eu/strategy/biodiversity-strategy-2030/3-billion-trees_en), the contractor will further promote the implementation of the EU pledge. In particular, it will promote the uptake of the pledge by liaising with potentially interested stakeholders (public and private organisations of land and forest owners, foresters, national and sub-national authorities) in all Member States; it will organise webinars and seminars/conferences; it will support the Commission on the outreach and organisation of the yearly three billion trees award. <br> Doc Title: Support for the implementation of the EU pledge on three billion additional trees by 2030 <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 600000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-08-11. Closing Date: 2025-10-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HUNELLE MOULIN. Summary: Multi-Attributor's Framework Agreement having the Delivery of Sustainable Foodstuffs: Dry Food, Fresh Fruits and Vegetables, Dairy Products, Meat, Frozen Products. Description: This procedure aims at the conclusion of a multi-attribute framework agreement, without prior fixing of all terms, with up to three attributors per lot, in accordance with article 43 of the law of June 17, 2016. It is carried out according to a competitive procedure with negotiation, in accordance in article 38 §1, 1 , 2 and 3 . The main purpose of the framework agreement is the supply of food products for the restaurant of the Moulin de la Hunnelle. The Moulin de la Hunelle is an adapted work company whose employees are primarily of people with disabilities. It offers a multitude of services, including a catering service. The framework agreement consists of 3 lots: - Lot 1: dairy and grocery products - Lot 2: Fruits and vegetables - Lot 3: Viandes and cold meats<br> Dairy, grocery and frozen products<br> Meats and cold meats<br> Doc title: framework agreement Multi-attributors whose purpose is the delivery of sustainable foodstuffs: dry food, fresh fruits and vegetables, dairy products, meat, frozen products<br> Type contract: supplies. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH GOVERNMENT. Summary: Fighting American Bird Cherry and Rododendron. Description: This assignment embraces the fighting of woody exotics in forests, more specifically; Fighting American bird cherry and rhododendron and to a lesser extent other exotics. The assignment is divided into 3 plots, each plot requires a specific approach that will be further in the technical provisions clarified. In all cases, different methods are explained: pulling out with the excavator, pulling out or digging out by hand, rings of trees, and so on. Certain methods will have to be applied per parcel. Please note: not all methods will be allowed on each domain. A follow -up treatment is always provided for 2 years by the assignment holder.<br> ANB-TB-TOW-2025-89-1 Antwerp Kempen<br> Domains small and large heath, the impact.<br> ANB-TB-TOW-2025-89-2 Flemish Ardennes-Scheldt Leie<br> Domains Makegemse Bossen, Parkbos Gent.<br> ANB-TB-TOW-2025-89-3 Coast-Westhoek and Sandy Flanders<br> Domains reuting forest, pecsteen, bulskampveld.<br> DOC Title: Fighting American bird cherry and Rododendron<br> Contract type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: PC SINT-HIERONYMUS VZW. Summary: Delivery of Dry Food. For all Items, both included in the inventory and in the catalog, is the price based on a fixed percentage discount on the catalog price. The catalog price with public rates is made available by the tenderer supplier throughout the entire duration of the assignment. The tenderer states in the quotation where this online catalog is made available. The catalog and the corresponding rates of the tenderer will be delivered free of charge by the tenderer and will be updated by the tenderer during the assignment with the applicable rates that are applicable Based on the evolution of the public online catalog. The percentage discount is fixed for the full duration of the assignment. To compare the quality, similar samples will be requested from both the inventory and from the catalog at an agreed time. The cuttings to be drained is exclusively from grasslands managed by the Agency for Nature and Forest. The material contains no cuttings from road verges which are accessible to motorized traffic. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: DE WERKVENNOOTSCHAP NV VAN PUBLIEK RECHT. Summary: Framework Agreement for Trial Trench Research and Various Small-Scale Works. Description: The subject of the assignment is to carry out small-scale works (including adaptation works), among others, at various intersections and short road sections of (mainly) regional roads and highways, but possibly also on municipal roads or near cycle (high)ways. The intended effects can be of various kinds, including increased traffic safety, smoother traffic flow, improvements for vulnerable road users, pilot projects, adaptation of infrastructure due to new private investor developments, etc. Additionally, trial trenches must be carried out to determine the presence and exact location of utility lines (x, y, z coordinates) and to prepare a report of the findings, in accordance with the practical guidelines for works in the vicinity of utility infrastructure in the public domain in Flanders. Finally, the Contractor must also be able to provide materials and equipment to other service providers or operate/process them themselves. The intention is not to use this Assignment solely as a maintenance contract. The services mainly (but not exclusively) include: - Breaking up pavements - Removing vegetation, felling trees - Earthworks - Placing (sub)foundations and pavements - Installing sewers - Management works: including supplying and operating/processing materials and/or equipment - Placing linear elements - Creating trial trenches - Measuring the detected lines (x, y, z coordinates) and reporting in DWG format and photo report - Signaling works and maintaining site signage - Pla.... Published Date: 2025-07-10. Closing Date: 2025-09-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

In all cases, different methods are explained: pulling out with the excavator, pulling out or digging out by hand, rings of trees, and so on. Certain methods will have to be applied per parcel. Please note: not all methods will be allowed on each domain. A follow -up treatment is always provided for 2 years by the assignment holder.<br> ANB-TB-TOW-2025-89-1 Antwerp Kempen<br> Domains small and large heath, the impact.<br> ANB-TB-TOW-2025-89-2 Flemish Ardennes-Scheldt Leie<br> Domains Makegemse Bossen, Parkbos Gent.<br> ANB-TB-TOW-2025-89-3 Coast-Westhoek and Sandy Flanders<br> Domains reuting forest, pecsteen, bulskampveld.<br> DOC Title: Fighting American bird cherry and Rododendron<br> Contract type: services

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: Scrapping Management Source Area Dommel, Bollisserbeek and Schansbeek. Description: The present assignment concerns the execution of a scraping management on various former arable plots owned by the Agency for Nature and Forest. The files are located in the source area of ​​the Dommel, Bollisserbeek, Schansbeek and Schietveld Houthalen. Generally dominate Sandy soils, because of their location in the landscape, the files vary from relatively dry to very wet. The assignment includes all operations to achieve successful scraping management. These operations include all the necessary soil operations, sowing, harvesting and the removal of All released biomass. Seeds are provided by the client. The purpose of this assignment is to remove the historical encouragement with phosphorus from the soil to prevent leaching. A cultivation plan was drawn up with the main objective of the soil of the soil. In addition, there is also Limited extent used for the fauna present in and around the area. The moisture condition goes from dry to fairly wet, for this reason it is necessary that the tenderer has adjusted machines available to prevent compaction of the soil.<br> Category (CPV code): Agricultural, Forestry, horticultural, aquacultural and apicultural services (77000000). Published Date: 2025-07-02. Closing Date: 2025-08-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: NATUURPUNT BEHEER VZW. Summary: Remove Tree Storage De Liereman. Description: Purpose of the works The intended works are part of the restoration of the European protected habitats wet heath 4010 and transitionsveen 7140. The works take place in the province of Antwerp in the municipality of Oud-Turnhout. The location of the plots on which works are planned are displayed on the cards in attachment. The works take place in a special protection zone (SBZ). The area was referred to by the European Union as a Habitats Directive area and is part of the Natura 2000 network. As a result, a number of vegetations and habitats are protected next to a whole list to rare animal species (species and habitats of the Habitats Directive). These works are aimed at restoring these Natura 2000 habitats. Nature of the assignment The works cover various work zones and include the removal of tree storage on wet peat soils and wet mineral soils, including Disruption of branch and trunk wood.<br> Category (CPV code): Tree-Clearing Services (77211300). Published Date: 2025-07-01. Closing Date: 2025-08-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: ANTWERP. Summary: Framework Agreement for Investigating Trees. Description: This framework agreement includes the assessment of the current situation and future perspectives of trees and their location on the public domain of the city of Antwerp. The assessment can include the following aspects: • Performing a visual tree rating of trees; • Performing a further research of stability and fracture sensitivity; • Performing a soil and growing place research including samples and lab analyzes In the assessment, an analysis is made of the existing condition and guidelines and recommendations are given for future development. The analysis is carried out according to the methods indicated in the sub -assignment. The guidelines are drawn up in accordance with the results from the analysis, the preconditions given and the knowledge of the contractor of materials and techniques.<br> GAC_2024_03140 - 1<br> DOC Title: Framework agreement for investigating from trees<br> Contract type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH GOVERNMENT. Summary: Nieuwe Waasmunsterbrug in the N446 over the Durme in Waasmunster (Kmpt. 4.22-4.85). Description: The aim of the contract is: the project aims at the renewal of the Waasmunsterbrug over the Durme in the N446 in Waasmunster and thus includes the Missing-Link in the redesign of the N446 between kilometers 4.22 to 4.85. Along both sides are connected to this already redesigned regional road. The project embraces, among other things: ● The demolition of the existing bridge; ● The construction of a new half -timbered bridge for the N446 over the Durme downstream of the existing bridge; ● The reconstruction of the approach slopes for the regional road along either side of the Durme to this new bridge; ● Construction of Connections to and from the towers along the Durme; ● the construction of a compensation forest in the northeast of the project area; ● bank repair at the level of the substructure of the existing bridge.<br> WOV/inv/N446/3/U1 - 1<br> Doc Title: New Waasmunsterbrug in the N446 on the Durme in Waasmunster (KMPT. 4.22-4.85)<br> Contract Type: Works. Published Date: 2025-06-16. Closing Date: 2025-09-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Nieuwe Waasmunsterbrug in the N446 over the Durme in Waasmunster (Kmpt. 4.22-4.85)

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: WIJNEGEM. Summary: Performing a Tree Risk Analysis and Vta. Description: This assignment consists of two parts that must be carried out on the Municipal Domain Kasteelpark Wijnegemhof, located in the municipality of Wijnegem: 1. Boom-risk analysis according to the QTRA method within the entire park area of ​​Kasteelpark Wijnegemhof is an extensive tree stock for which a systematic risk analysis must be carried out. This analysis is done according to the QTRTO method (Quantified Tree Risk Assessment), a standardized and numerical approach that objectively estimates the risk of damage or injury due to tree failure. The analysis must be it cover a complete tree stock within the park area. Only persons with a valid QTRA certification, achieved via Inverde or another recognized authority, may perform this analysis. The tenderer adds a copy of this certificate as proof in his quotation. 2. Visual Tree Assessment (VTA) There is also a veteran Knotlinde from a veteran knotlinde on the domain that must be investigated separately via a Visual Tree Assessment (VTA). This research focuses on visual characteristics of possible defects, wood rot, stability problems and other structural risks. It Consistent management advice must take into account the ecological and landscape importance of this valuable tree. Both parts must be performed by an expert with demonstrable experience in tree safety controls and tree-ecological advice.<br> Category (CPV code): Tree-maintena.... Published Date: 2025-06-13. Closing Date: 2025-07-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Performing a Tree Risk Analysis and Vta

Description: In order to support the operation and activities of the services, Local Governance wishes to conclude a new framework agreement with 2 entrepreneurs for the delivery of beverages and accessories. In addition to the articles listed in the inventory, all other articles offered by the contractor (s) can also be the subject of this agreement. A framework agreement will be concluded with a maximum of two participants for a period of 48 months. The conditions of the assignments based on the framework agreement are fully laid down in the specifications, with the exception of the quantities to be purchased. The estimated amount of publication is around € 49,000 excl. VAT per year annually (based on the effective expenditure of the past year). This information is merely indicative. They do not bind the board in any way. The contractor cannot demand (damage) compensation if this estimated amount is not achieved. Description: Detailed work scope The following are the Selected Organisation-s key activities: 1.Training and Advisory Services A. Planning and Design Phase •Define the agronomic advisory strategy, including frequency, format, monitoring, data collection, and reporting. •Establish criteria for the selection of farms participating in the project. •Prepare the project-s training plan, with proposed content aligned with the expected transitions and the agronomic cycle. •Develop methodologies for: oSingle-day advisory and group training sessions for farmers; oSingle-day group training sessions for corporate advisors (up to 10 advisors per year), aligned with EIT Food and corporate partners- guidelines. •Design an advice, control, and monitoring plan for the advisory services. The technical advice must propose the most effective/viable alternatives to scale up the project, by type of farm, and agronomic area. This includes farmers of each profile, as well as farms at the territorial level. •Ensure readiness and capacity to continuously improve the advisory action plan in response to evolving needs. B. Farmer Engagement •Support EIT Food and corporate partners in farmer recruitment efforts, such as: oParticipation in dissemination days and corporate farmer events. •Target minimum farmer participation objectives: o2025: 50 farmers o2026: 120 farmers (+70) o2027: 200 farmers (+80) C. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BOTANIC GARDEN MEISE. Summary: Framework Agreement Delivery of Organic Fruit and Vegetables in Plant Garden Meise, Period 2025-2029. Description: This assignment concerns a framework agreement for the delivery of self-produced, 100% organic vegetables, fruit and herbs for the Botanic Garden Meise for the period 2025-2029. The selected supplier is responsible for the timely and conforming delivery of the products in accordance with the needs and specifications of the contracting authority. The contracting author, however, reserves the right to purchase the products from the selected supplier elsewhere, depending on the supplier's stock. In addition to the delivery of the organic products, the supplier undertakes to organize an educational activity twice a year on the field where the vegetables are produced. This activity is aimed at the Kitchen Team of Botanic Garden Meise and aims: to increase product knowledge at the kitchen team; Offering inspiration for the kitchen through a direct introduction to cultivation and production methods. The supplier is responsible for the entire organization of this activity.
